commit.message:
configure.in (*-pc-msdosdjgpp): Set float_format to none.

        * configure.in (*-pc-msdosdjgpp): Set float_format to none.
        * configure: Rebuilt.

From-SVN: r34004

files.patch:
@@ -1,3 +1,8 @@
+2000-05-18 Mark Elbrecht <snowball3@bigfoot.com>
+
+        * configure.in (*-pc-msdosdjgpp): Set float_format to none.
+	* configure: Rebuilt.
+
 2000-05-18  Zack Weinberg  <zack@wolery.cumb.org>
 
 	* genopinit.c: Use $ for escape sequences in optab patterns.

@@ -4344,6 +4344,7 @@ for machine in $build $host $target; do
 		gnu_ld=yes
 		gas=yes
 		exeext=.exe
+		float_format=none
 		case $host in *pc-msdosdjgpp*)
 			target_alias=djgpp
 			;;
@@ -6811,15 +6812,15 @@ fi
 
 
         echo $ac_n "checking for strerror in -lcposix""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6815: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
+echo "configure:6816: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
 ac_lib_var=`echo cposix'_'strerror | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 LIBS="-lcposix  $LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6823 "configure"
+#line 6824 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -6830,7 +6831,7 @@ int main() {
 strerror()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6834: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6835: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
@@ -6853,12 +6854,12 @@ fi
   
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working const""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6857: checking for working const" >&5
+echo "configure:6858: checking for working const" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_const'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6862 "configure"
+#line 6863 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
@@ -6907,7 +6908,7 @@ ccp = (char const *const *) p;
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6911: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6912: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_c_const=yes
 else
@@ -6928,21 +6929,21 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for inline""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6932: checking for inline" >&5
+echo "configure:6933: checking for inline" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_inline'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_cv_c_inline=no
 for ac_kw in inline __inline__ __inline; do
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6939 "configure"
+#line 6940 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
 } $ac_kw foo() {
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6946: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6947: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_c_inline=$ac_kw; break
 else
@@ -6968,12 +6969,12 @@ EOF
 esac
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for off_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6972: checking for off_t" >&5
+echo "configure:6973: checking for off_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_off_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6977 "configure"
+#line 6978 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -7001,12 +7002,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for size_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7005: checking for size_t" >&5
+echo "configure:7006: checking for size_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_size_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7010 "configure"
+#line 7011 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -7036,19 +7037,19 @@ fi
 # The Ultrix 4.2 mips builtin alloca declared by alloca.h only works
 # for constant arguments.  Useless!
 echo $ac_n "checking for working alloca.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7040: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
+echo "configure:7041: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_alloca_h'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7045 "configure"
+#line 7046 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <alloca.h>
 int main() {
 char *p = alloca(2 * sizeof(int));
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7052: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7053: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_header_alloca_h=yes
 else
@@ -7069,12 +7070,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for alloca""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7073: checking for alloca" >&5
+echo "configure:7074: checking for alloca" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_alloca_works'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7078 "configure"
+#line 7079 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #ifdef __GNUC__
@@ -7102,7 +7103,7 @@ int main() {
 char *p = (char *) alloca(1);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7106: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7107: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_func_alloca_works=yes
 else
@@ -7134,12 +7135,12 @@ EOF
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7138: checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks" >&5
+echo "configure:7139: checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_os_cray'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7143 "configure"
+#line 7144 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #if defined(CRAY) && ! defined(CRAY2)
 webecray
@@ -7164,12 +7165,12 @@ echo "$ac_t""$ac_cv_os_cray" 1>&6
 if test $ac_cv_os_cray = yes; then
 for ac_func in _getb67 GETB67 getb67; do
   echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7168: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:7169: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7173 "configure"
+#line 7174 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -7192,7 +7193,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7196: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7197: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -7219,15 +7220,15 @@ done
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking stack direction for C alloca""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7223: checking stack direction for C alloca" >&5
+echo "configure:7224: checking stack direction for C alloca" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_stack_direction'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   ac_cv_c_stack_direction=0
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7231 "configure"
+#line 7232 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 find_stack_direction ()
 {
@@ -7246,7 +7247,7 @@ main ()
   exit (find_stack_direction() < 0);
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7250: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:7251: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_c_stack_direction=1
 else
@@ -7273,17 +7274,17 @@ unistd.h sys/param.h
 do
 ac_safe=`echo "$ac_hdr" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_hdr""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7277: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
+echo "configure:7278: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7282 "configure"
+#line 7283 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <$ac_hdr>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:7287: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:7288: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -7313,12 +7314,12 @@ done
 strdup __argz_count __argz_stringify __argz_next
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7317: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:7318: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7322 "configure"
+#line 7323 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -7341,7 +7342,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7345: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7346: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -7370,12 +7371,12 @@ done
      for ac_func in stpcpy
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7374: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:7375: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7379 "configure"
+#line 7380 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -7398,7 +7399,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7402: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7403: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -7432,19 +7433,19 @@ EOF
 
    if test $ac_cv_header_locale_h = yes; then
     echo $ac_n "checking for LC_MESSAGES""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7436: checking for LC_MESSAGES" >&5
+echo "configure:7437: checking for LC_MESSAGES" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'am_cv_val_LC_MESSAGES'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7441 "configure"
+#line 7442 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <locale.h>
 int main() {
 return LC_MESSAGES
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7448: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7449: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   am_cv_val_LC_MESSAGES=yes
 else
@@ -7465,7 +7466,7 @@ EOF
     fi
   fi
    echo $ac_n "checking whether NLS is requested""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7469: checking whether NLS is requested" >&5
+echo "configure:7470: checking whether NLS is requested" >&5
         # Check whether --enable-nls or --disable-nls was given.
 if test "${enable_nls+set}" = set; then
   enableval="$enable_nls"
@@ -7485,7 +7486,7 @@ fi
 EOF
 
       echo $ac_n "checking whether included gettext is requested""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7489: checking whether included gettext is requested" >&5
+echo "configure:7490: checking whether included gettext is requested" >&5
       # Check whether --with-included-gettext or --without-included-gettext was given.
 if test "${with_included_gettext+set}" = set; then
   withval="$with_included_gettext"
@@ -7504,17 +7505,17 @@ fi
 
 	ac_safe=`echo "libintl.h" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for libintl.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7508: checking for libintl.h" >&5
+echo "configure:7509: checking for libintl.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7513 "configure"
+#line 7514 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <libintl.h>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:7518: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:7519: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -7531,19 +7532,19 @@ fi
 if eval "test \"`echo '$ac_cv_header_'$ac_safe`\" = yes"; then
   echo "$ac_t""yes" 1>&6
   echo $ac_n "checking for gettext in libc""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7535: checking for gettext in libc" >&5
+echo "configure:7536: checking for gettext in libc" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gt_cv_func_gettext_libc'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7540 "configure"
+#line 7541 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <libintl.h>
 int main() {
 return (int) gettext ("")
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7547: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7548: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   gt_cv_func_gettext_libc=yes
 else
@@ -7559,15 +7560,15 @@ echo "$ac_t""$gt_cv_func_gettext_libc" 1>&6
 
 	   if test "$gt_cv_func_gettext_libc" != "yes"; then
 	     echo $ac_n "checking for bindtextdomain in -lintl""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7563: checking for bindtextdomain in -lintl" >&5
+echo "configure:7564: checking for bindtextdomain in -lintl" >&5
 ac_lib_var=`echo intl'_'bindtextdomain | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 LIBS="-lintl  $LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7571 "configure"
+#line 7572 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -7578,7 +7579,7 @@ int main() {
 bindtextdomain()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7582: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7583: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
@@ -7594,20 +7595,20 @@ fi
 if eval "test \"`echo '$ac_cv_lib_'$ac_lib_var`\" = yes"; then
   echo "$ac_t""yes" 1>&6
   echo $ac_n "checking for gettext in libintl""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7598: checking for gettext in libintl" >&5
+echo "configure:7599: checking for gettext in libintl" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gt_cv_func_gettext_libintl'+set}'`\" = set"; then

-echo "configure:7603: checking for gettext in -lintl" >&5
+echo "configure:7604: checking for gettext in -lintl" >&5

 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 LIBS="-lintl  $LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7611 "configure"
+#line 7612 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -7618,7 +7619,7 @@ int main() {
 gettext()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7622: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7623: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
@@ -7657,7 +7658,7 @@ EOF
 	      # Extract the first word of "msgfmt", so it can be a program name with args.
 set dummy msgfmt; ac_word=$2
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_word""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7661: checking for $ac_word" >&5
+echo "configure:7662: checking for $ac_word" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_path_MSGFMT'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -7691,12 +7692,12 @@ fi
 		for ac_func in dcgettext
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7695: checking for $ac_func" >&5

 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then

@@ -7719,7 +7720,7 @@ $ac_func();

@@ -7814,15 +7815,15 @@ else
